selected_quotes: Students gain weight throughout college; weight control interventions should target more than just 1st years
Longitudinal study suggests that college students gain #weight throughout college-not just their Freshman year
Examining the Weight Trajectory of College Students Study published in @JNEBonline #BMI #College…
You may have implied weight was measured in grams instead of Newtons. Did you mean MASS? If not, have a nice day :)
#College students get fat. 23% overweight as frosh. 41% overweight as seniors. 1 rsn: Vegetable consumption declines htt…

citation.abstract:
To examine the weight trajectory of students over 4 years of college.
Anthropometric assessments were completed at the beginning and end of students' freshman year and the end of senior year to calculate body mass index. Questionnaires assessing weight-related behaviors were completed in senior year.
Of the original 117 students, 86 remained in the study for 4 years. Body mass index was significantly higher at the end of senior year (mean, 24.84; SD, 4.46) vs the beginning of freshman year (mean, 23.59; SD, 4.01; t[85] = 5.61; P < .001). Weight was significantly higher at the end of senior year (mean, 71.32 kg; SD, 15.60) vs the beginning of freshman year (mean, 66.94 kg; SD, 14.02; t[85] = 6.60; P < .001). Students' mean weight gain was 4.38 kg and the sample increased from 23% to 41% overweight/obese. No significant associations were found between BMI and lifestyle factors.
This study suggests that students gain weight throughout college, which highlights the need for weight control interventions to target more than just freshman college students.
citation.journal: Journal of Nutrition Education and Behavior
citation.title: Examining the Weight Trajectory of College Students

news.title: What else comes with a college degree? An extra 10 pounds, says new study
news.summary: College students are carrying more than a diploma across the stage at graduation.

news.title: College degree may also earn you extra kilos: study
news.summary: Completing a college course may not only earn you a degree, but also add an extra 4.5 kgs of weight along with the associated health risks, a new study has claimed.
